intro: Biscutella laevigata subsp. montenegrina, commonly known as the Montenegro biscuitflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Balkan region. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in racemes, and its lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is adapted to temperate climates. This subspecies is of interest in botanical studies due to its limited distribution and unique morphological features.
